sanskrit: पाञ्चजन्यं हृषीकेशो देवदत्तं धनंजयः| पौण्ड्रं दध्मौ महाशङ्खं भीमकर्मा वृकोदरः
Translation: Hrishikesha blew the Panchajanya, Arjuna blew the Devadatta, and Bhima, the wolf-bellied doer of terrible deeds, blew the great conch Paundra.
answer: The conches of Krishna, Arjuna, and Bhima are mentioned in this verse. The names of the conches are: Pañcajanya, which belonged to Krishna (also known as Hrishikesha), Devadatta, which belonged to Arjuna (also known as Dhananjaya), and Paundra, which belonged to Bhima (also known as Vrikodara or Bheemakarma, the doer of mighty deeds).
